abstract.shortdesc: This section describe the User Management User Interfaces.

section.title: User Management
section.p:
The User Management main page consists of the following components:
Users List Tabs
Action Bar

section.title: Users List Tabs
section.p: Local Users Tab
Federated Users Tab

Federated users are remote users syncrhonized from an external Identity Provider (IdP) to ENM by Federated Identity Syncrhonizer security function. See the document ENM Identity and Access Management System Administrator Guide, 2/1543-AOM 901 151-1 for details. This is available in the ENM CPI Library, EN/LZN 703 0205.
The tables give the details on each user:

ul.li: Username: is the user identity, used to log on to ENM.
Status: is the status of the user. The values are enabled and disabled.
Name
Surname
Description: additional free text field. It can be used to describe users that belong a certain location or department.
Authentication Mode: it can be set local or remote.
Email

Credential Status: is the information about the user certificate. The possible values are:
Not Applicable: it occurs when no corresponding PKI End Entity for the user exists.
New: it occurs when the corresponding PKI End Entity for the user has been created but no certificates are associated to the user.
Active: it occurs when the corresponding PKI End Entity for the user has been created and a valid certificate is associated to the user.
Deleted: it occurs when the corresponding PKI End Entity for the user has been deleted.
Inactive: it occurs when the corresponding PKI End Entity for the user has been created but no valid certificate is associated to the user (this happens when all certificates associated to the user are revoked or expired).
Credential Status values meaning:
Active: means that the user has a valid certificate associated.
New, Deleted, Inactive, Not Applicable: means that the user has no valid certificate associated.
Last Login: is the last time user successful logged in to ENM.
Failed Logins: is the counter of failed user logins since the last successful login. It is reset on successful user login. 0 values are hidden.
Force Password Change: is the information about the force password change.
Password Ageing: is the information about password ageing. It can be set to system settings or can be customized (More information).
Information on Sync Status: is the information about the synchronization status for only Federared Users of an external LDAP with ENM system.

section.p: For Local Users all the previous information indicated below is reported in Local Users table. For Federated Users, only Username, Credential Status, Last Login and Failed Logins is reported in Federated Users table.

In the Local User tab a warning box is reported if the WebPush subscription for Import events is not established. In this case the Import function is disabled. Install the ENM trusted certificates into the client browser and restart the server. See the document ENM Identity and Access Management System Administration Guide, 2/1543-AOM 901 151-1 for details. This is available in the ENM CPI Library, EN/LZN 703 0205.

When a user is selected in the User Management table, the Selected Users Information message is displayed. The message indicates how many users have been selected. Clicking the Clear Selection clears all selected users and the Selected User Information Message disappears from the screen.

It is also possible to select all users on the User Management table. Once the link has been clicked on, the message automatically updates to indicate that all users have now been selected and a new link appears with the option to clear all selected users.
In the Federated Users table, into Federated tab an info box is reported with the synchronization status and the date of the last synchronization.

The possible Sync Status values are:
Init: the configuration data not yet retrieved (from PSQL via GIC).
Not Configured: the configuration data have been never imported.
Disabled: the administrative state of synchronization is disabled.
Idle: the administrative state of synchronization is enable. No synchronization is currently in progress.
Periodic Sync in Progress: periodic synchronization is currently in progress.
Forced Sync in Progress: forced synchronization is currently in progress.
Test Sync in Progress: test synchronization is currently in progress.
Forced Delete In Progress: forced delete of all federated users is currently in progress.
Click the Refresh to refresh the synchronization data and The Federated Users list.
If the number of defined users exceeds the number of users to display, the list exceeds one page:
It is possible to adjust the number of users displayed.

section.title: Table Settings
section.p: The Table Settings option configures the columns according to user preference. On selection of preferred settings, click the Apply button to save the table settings to the Workflows table.
Local Users
Federated Users

li.p: Rearrange displayed columns being displayed by dragging the icon displayed.

The
icon in the header indicates that sorting is enabled on the column. The darkened arrow indicates current sort mode.
All columns in the table are resizable to allow easy access to content larger than the displayed in the cell.

section.title: Action Bar
section.p: After selecting one or more users, additional options appear in the action bar accordingly with the selected tab, Local Users or Federated Users.
Local Users Tab
Federated Users Tab
Create User Profile - to create new user (More Information).
Import - to import user profiles from an XML file (More Information).
Edit Profile - to edit user (More Information).
Edit Multiple Users - to edit users (More Information).
Change Password - to change user local password (More Information).
Duplicate - to create user by using another user as a template (More Information).
Delete - to delete user(s) (More Information).
Terminate Sessions - terminate all active sessions (More Information).
Enable/Disable User - enable or disable one or more selected users (More Information).
Profile Summary - checking summary of single user (More Information).
Force Password Change - change user password when the user is in view mode (More Information).
Revoke Force Password Change - Force password change operation has been revoked (More Information).
Export - to export selected user profiles to an XML file (More Information).
Envelope - to check status of ongoing Import process (More information).
Filters - User can filter users list using criteria (More Information).
For a selected federated user, the list of available actions is: Change Password, Terminate Session, and Revoke Certificate (if a valid certificate is available for the selected user).

section.title: Create User
section.p: The user needs to fill eight mandatory fields:

ul.li:
Username: the username can contain small and capital letters, but a user cannot have multiple accounts with case mismatch.
Only alphanumeric characters are accepted: every character in user name must be one of : a-z, A-Z, 0-9, _, -, .
Furthermore some names are invalid: ".", "..", "root", "bin", "daemon", "adm", "lp", "sync", "shutdown", "halt", "mail", "news", "uucp", "operator", "games", "gopher", "ftp", "nobody", "rpm", "vcsa", "dbus", "ntp", "canna", "nscd", "rpc", "postfix", "mailman", "named", "amanda", "postgres", "exim", "sshd", "rpcuser", "nsfnobody", "pvm", "apache", "xfs", "gdm", "htt", "mysql", "webalizer", "mailnull", "smmsp", "squid", "ldap", "netdump", "pcap", "radiusd", "radvd", "quagga", "wnn", "dovecot", "litp-admin", "saslauth", "nfsnobody", "ovirtagent", "cloud-user", "tcpdump", "haproxy", "enmadm", "jboss_user", "nslcd", "ssouser", "ldapapplicationuser", "npamuser".
Authentication Mode: the authentication mode can be Local or Remote. The default value is Local.

Local Password: the password must comply with the password policy displayed in box on the right of screen. Only alphanumeric characters are accepted. Password policy can change depending on system security settings.
Repeat Local Password: Local Password and Repeat Local Password fields must match.
Off (Disabled): the user is redirected to Application Launcher page at first login.
On (Enabled): the user has permissions to access applications it has roles assigned to when it is already logged in.
The default value is On (Enabled).
Disabled: the user can not log on ENM.
Enabled: the user can log on ENM.
The default value is Disabled.
Use System Settings: user password time ageing keeps the global settings from the System Security Configuration app.

Customize Password Ageing: allows to set customized values for password ageing.
Enable Password Ageing: enable/disable user password time validity; if disabled, password never expires.
Number of days password is valid.
Number of days to password expiration warning: a warning about password expiration is shown the inserted number of days before that happens.

li.p: For more information, see also Password Aging Warning page.

ul.li: At least a role must be assigned to a user.

Roles can be divided into three families:
Service Role family:
System Role
Custom Role
COM Role family:
COM Role
COM Role Alias
Task Profile Role family:
Task Profile Role
When a role is assigned to a user profile, target groups are handled differently based on the role family:
All associated roles belonging to the Service Role family refer to a common list of target groups
All associated roles belonging to the COM Role family refer to their own list of target groups
All associated roles belonging to the Task Profile Role family refer to their own list of target groups
To assign one or more target groups to a Service Role a button "Service Target Groups" is located above the column header Target Groups Assigned with the information of number of associated target groups.
To assign one or more target groups to a COM Role a button "COM Target Groups" is available with the information of number of associated target groups in the column Target Groups Assigned in Roles table.
To assign one or more target groups to a Task Profile Role a button "Task Profile Target Groups" is available with the information of number of associated target groups in the column Target Groups Assigned in Roles table.

the Authentication Mode parameter is used in case of configured external IdP with RAuthN set to true value. In case no external IdP is configured or RAuthN is set to false, the user is locally authenticated regardless of Authentication Mode selected on the UI. In case an external IdP is configured and RAuthN is set to true, the user is remotely authenticated if the Authentication Mode selected on the UI is Remote. No check is done by UI on graying out of Local or Remote accordingly with the server setup.
If BO/Netan capabilities are assigned to user it must not exceed 20 characters in length, due to Active Directory limitation.
If the user has at least a Task Profile Role or a Custom Role containing Task Proifile Roles, the LAAD file has to be redistributed to the CPP nodes that the user access to.
Maximum 48 users per CPP node are allowed (this includes disabled users).
Maximum 10 Task Profile Roles per user are allowed.
It is not possible to create a federated user.

Since the PKI Entity name cannot be less than 3 chars, if the username length is less than 3 chars the user can't have an own certificate. It is a limitation for all ENM applications that require a user certificate.
In case of Enforce User Hardening, password ageing is always enabled.

The Force Change Password switcher is disabled (grayed) and set to On if the Enforce User Hardening is enabled. See the document ENM Node Hardening Guidelines and Instructions, 1/17473-AOM 901 151-1 for details. This is available in the ENM CPI Library, EN/LZN 703 0205.

p.b: Following errors can occur when saving users:

section.p:
Use username does not comply with naming policies:
Every character in user name must be one of : a-z, A-Z, 0-9, _, -, .

ul.li: Password and Repeat New Password fields must match.

The email, if present, must be valid in the form john@example.com.
Note: the first character must not be a number.
User role is not selected.
Username is not unique.
Username is invalid.
Limit of 48 Users per CPP node has been exceeded.
Limit of 10 Task Profile Roles per user has been exceeded.

conbody.section:
Edit User
The following fields can be edited only for Local Users:
Name
Surname
Email
Description
Status
Disabled: the user is not be able to log on ENM next time.
Security Warning: Disable User does not include terminating all the user sessions â€“ use Terminate Sessions for that purpose.
Security Warning: The user cannot disable himself.
Enabled: the user can log on ENM.
Authentication Mode: the authentication mode can be Local or Remote. The default value is Local.
Password Ageing
Use System Settings: user password time aging keeps the global settings from the System Security Configuration app.
Customize Password Ageing: allows to set customized values for password aging.
Enable Password Ageing: enable/disable user password time validity; if disabled, password never expires.
Number of days password is valid.
Number of days to password expiration warning: a warning about password expiration is shown the inserted number of days before that happens.
For more information see also Password Ageing Warning page.
Roles and Target Groups:
At least a role must be assigned to a user.
Roles can be divided into three families:
Service Role family:
System Role
Custom Role
COM Role family:
COM Role
COM Role Alias
Task Profile Role family:
Task Profile Role
When a role is assigned to a user profile, target groups are handled differently based on the Role family:
All associated Roles belonging to the Service Role family refer to a common list of target groups
All associated Roles belonging to the COM Role family refer to their own list of target groups
All associated Roles belonging to the Task Profile Role family refer to their own list of target groups
To assign one or more target groups to a Service Role a button "Service Target Groups" is located above the column header Target Groups Assigned with the information of number of associated target groups.
To assign one or more target groups to a COM Role a button "COM Target Groups" is available with the information of number of associated target groups in the column Target Groups Assigned in Roles table.
To assign one or more target groups to a Task Profile Role a button "Task Profile Target Groups" is available with the information of number of associated target groups in the column Target Groups Assigned in Roles table.
The user cannot edit the Username field.
Notes:
It is possible to associate one or more target groups to user roles.
Not assign more than 10 Task Profile Roles to a user.
If the user change is about:
Assign/Unassign a Task Profile Role or change the own Task Profile Target Groups list
Assign/Unassign a Custom Role containing Task Profile Roles or change Service Target Groups list
Status field of a user with at least a Task Profile Role or a Custom Role containing Task Profile Roles assigned
The LAAD file has to be redistributed to the involved CPP nodes.
Maximum 48 users per CPP node are allowed (this includes disabled users).
Maximum 10 Task Profile Roles per user are allowed.
In case of Enforce User Hardening, password ageing is always enabled.
It is not possible to update a federated user.

section.title: Edit Multiple Users
section.p:
The Edit User Profiles page consists of the following components:
Details
Roles and Target Groups
Authentication
Summary
Apply

In the section Details the user can edit the fields:
Modify Status - Allows the user to change the status to enable or disable.
Modify Description - Allows the user to edit field description.

In the section Roles and Target Groups the user can edit the fields:
Modify Roles and Target Groups - Allows the user to assign and unassign roles and target groups.

Notes:
It is possible to filter on Assigned/Not Assigned Roles, Type (COM Role, COM Role Alias, Custom Role, ENM System Role, Task Profile) and Status (Enabled, Disabled, Not Assignable).
It is possible to associate one or more target groups to users roles.
Not assign more than 10 Task Profile Roles to a user.
If the user change is about:
Assign/Unassign a Task Profile Role or change the own Task Profile Target Groups list
Assign/Unassign a Custom Role containing Task Profile Roles or change Service Target Groups list
Status field of a user with at least a Task Profile Role or a Custom Role containing Task Profile Roles assigned
The LAAD file has to be redistributed to the relevant CPP nodes.
Maximum 48 users per CPP node are allowed (this includes disabled users).
Maximum 10 Task Profile Roles per user are allowed.
It is not possible to update a federated user.

In the section Authentication the user can edit the fields:
Modify Authentication Mode - Allows the user to change authentication mode to Local or Remote.
Modify Password Ageing - Allows the user to customize the password ageing (More information).
The section Summary displays what changes have been entered.
After selecting field "Modify Roles" and not selecting any roles, it appears the following information in module Summary No user role has been selected.
The section Apply displays how many users have been edited.

conbody.section:
Duplicate User
A user can be created using another user as a template. The new user is assigned any roles assigned to the original user.
The mandatory fields have to be filled as they are empty by default:
Username
Name
Surname
Local Password
Repeat Local Password
The optional fields can be filled:
Email
Status
Description
Roles
Force Password Change
Password Ageing (More information)
Authentication Mode
Note:
The Authentication Mode value for duplicated user is the same of the original ones.
Maximum 48 users per CPP node are allowed (this includes disabled users).
Maximum 10 Task Profile Roles per user are allowed.
It is not possible to duplicate a federated user.

section.title: Delete Users
section.p: Select any user(s) in the list and click Delete to delete the user(s). A notification displays how many users have been selected for deletion.
To confirm deletion, click Delete on the Delete Selected Users window.
To cancel the operation and return to the main page, click Cancel.
Successful deletion of a user profile is confirmed when following notification is displayed:

li.b: Security Warning: The user cannot delete himself.

ul.li: If the user has at least a Task Profile Roles or a Custom Roles containg Task Profile Roles assigned, the LAAD file has to be redistributed to the relevant CPP nodes.
It is not possible delete a federated user. See the document ENM System Security Configuration Programmers Guide, 1/19817-CNA 403 3065 to remove all the federated users.

conbody.section:
Terminate Sessions
To terminate user session, there are two ways:
Select the user(s) and then click Terminate Sessions in the action bar.
or
Select the user and click Profile Summary on the actions bar to display the Profile Summary panel. The Profile Summary gives a count of the active sessions for the user. Click Terminate Session to terminate all active sessions of the selected user.
The following message is displayed:

section.title: Enable/Disable Users
section.p:
To disable a user:
Select one or more user(s) and then click Disable User button in the action bar.

To enable a user:
Select one or more disabled user(s) and then click Enable User button in the action bar.

section.title: Profile Summary
section.p: Local Users
Federated Users
A summary of the topmost selected users profile appears on the right panel. This displays their username and the users roles.
To open Profile Summary panel, select a single user in the table and click Profile Summary icon on the actions bar.
If the Profile Summary panel is opened and no user is selected, "Select one User to view details" is displayed in Profile Summary.
The Profile Summary panel contains Session Details information.

Session Instance field, indicating the number of active sessions of a particular user.
Terminate Sessions button, to terminate all active sessions.
For the federated users the Edit button is not available.

section.title: Change User Local Password
section.p: The user needs to fill three mandatory fields:

ul.li: New Local Password: the password must comply with the local password policy displayed in box on the right of screen. Only alphanumeric characters are accepted.
Repeat New Local Password: password and Repeat New Local Password fields must match.
Off (Disabled): the user is redirected to Application Launcher page at first login.
On (Enabled): the user has permissions to access applications it has roles assigned to when it is already logged in.
The default value in the status is On (Enabled).

If the user has at least a Task Profile Role assigned or a Custom Role containing Task Profile Roles, the LAAD file has to be redistribute to the CPP nodes that user has access to. In case of federated user and local user with remote authentication, the local password is used for ENM authentication in case of LDAP remote is not available and for CPP nodes with Local Authentication and Authorization activated.

The Force Change Password switcher is disabled (grayed) and set to On if the Enforce User Hardening is enabled. See the document ENM Node Hardening Guidelines and Instructions, 1/17473-AOM 901 151-1 for details. This is available in the ENM CPI Library, EN/LZN 703 0205.

section.p: In case of successfully changed password, the following message appears:
Following errors can occur:

ul.li: New Local Password and Repeat New Local Password fields do not match.
New Local Password does not fulfill the Local Password Policies.

section.title: Force Password Change
section.p: To force the change of the password at next login, select the user and click Force Password Change in the action bar when the user is in view mode.
The following message is displayed:
User(s) needs to update the password on the next login.
After filling the field Current Local Password, the fields New Local Password and Repeat New Local Password are unlocked.
It is not possible to force the local password change for federated users.

section.title: Revoke Force Password Change
section.p: To revoke change password, select the user and click Revoke Force Password Change in the action bar when the user is in view mode.
The following message is displayed:
User(s) does not need to update the password on the next login.
It is not possible to revoke the force local password change for federated users.

It is not possible to revoke the force local password change if the Enforced User Hardening is enabled. See the document ENM Node Hardening Guidelines and Instructions, 1/17473-AOM 901 151-1 for details. This is available in the ENM CPI Library, EN/LZN 703 0205.

section.title: Import and Export
section.p: Import user profiles from an XML file. Up to 1,000 users can be imported from a single file.
Click Import button to open file selection window.

Note: If Import button is disabled means that the WebPush subscription is not performed correctly. In this case install the ENM trusted certificates into the client browser and restart the server. See the document ENM Identity and Access Management System Administration Guide, 2/1543-AOM 901 151-1 for details. This is available in the ENM CPI Library, EN/LZN 703 0205.
Select file to be imported and click OK. Import process starts.
It is not possible to import a federated user.
The following assumptions must be met:

ul.li: At least one privilege assigned to a user is required.
Import option cannot be used to change user password.
A user password is required to create a new user profile.
Role(s) and target group (s) to be assigned to user has to be already available in the ENM system.
The file containing user profiles must have following structure:

section.p: Optional tags description, email, passwordAgeing, authMode can be added to the user profiles XML file, for example:

ul.li: authMode can be set local or remote.
pwdMaxAge, pwdExpireWarning are mandatory only if customizedPasswordAgeingEnable and passwordAgeingEnable are set to true.
Not assign more than 10 Task Profile Roles to a user.

section.p: Import process starts with analysis of file to be imported. The summary is presented in dialog window.
Warning is presented in case system wide roles are removed as a result of Import operation.
Import Only New button appears in case there are new and existing user profiles to import.
Click View link button to list users who are going to lose system wide roles.
To continue import process click Import All button. To terminate it, click Cancel.
Progress info pill appears, visible by all users.
When import process completes progress info pill content is refreshed automatically.
Click Import Progress button or envelope button to make Notifications panel visible. Notifications panel displays current state of import operation.
Notification panel for successfully completed import operation.
Click View Report to get import report file.
An example of report.json file:
A value of importStatus can be:

ul.li: SUCCESS - when all user profiles have been imported successfully.
PARTIAL_SUCCESS - when not all user profiles have been imported.
FAILURE - when no user profile has been imported or import process failed.

section.title: Export
section.p: Export selected user profiles to an XML file. Up to 1,000 users can be exported to a single file.
Exported file can be used to modify users profiles by using Import option.
Due to security reasons a password is not exported.
As result, the Export function cannot be used as a backup of defined ENM users.
To export users, select users and click Export button.
In the pop-up window, choose a localization to save UsersProfiles.xml.
There is an availability to filter users with chosen attribute and then export filtered users profiles.
After successful export of user profiles, the following message is displayed:
Trying to export more than a 1,000 users profiles results in an error message:

section.title: Filters
section.p: Filters configuration section slides from right side of User Management application after clicking Filters button in top-right section on action bar.
User can filter local users list using following criteria:

ul.li: Username - Filter the users displayed in Users table by entering the full username or Unix regular expression. Capitalization does not matter.
Name - Filter the users displayed in Users table by entering the full name or Unix regular expression. Capitalization does not matter.
Surname - Filter the users displayed in Users table by entering the full surname or Unix regular expression. Capitalization does not matter.
Description - Filter the users displayed in Users table by entering the full description or Unix regular expression. Capitalization does not matter.
Status - Filter users according to their status by selecting the Enabled or Disabled option.
Last Login - In an empty field in Logged in within last days, enter the number of days.
Failed Logins - Filter users with or without failed login attempts by selecting the Yes or No option.
Authentication Mode - Filter users with local or remote authentication mode by selecting the Local or Remote option.

Credential Status - Filter the credential status values by checking the relevant checkboxes:
Active: means that the user has a valid certificate associated.
New, Deleted, Inactive, Not Applicable: means that the user has no valid certificate associated.
Currently Logged in - Filter the currently logged in or not logged in users by selecting the Yes or No option.
Expired Password - Filter users with expired or not expired password by selecting Yes or No option.
Password Ageing - Filter users with customized or not customized password ageing by selecting Custom Settings or System Settings option.

Roles - Filter the roles in users by checking the roles checkbox.
= Filtering on users with this role assigned
!= Filtering on users with this role not assigned

section.p: User can filter federated users list using following criteria:

ul.li: Username - Filter the users displayed in Users table by entering the full username or Unix regular expression. Capitalization does not matter.
Last Login - In an empty field in Logged in within last days, enter the number of days.
Failed Logins - Filter users with or without failed login attempts by selecting the Yes or No option.

Credential Status - Filter the credential status values by checking the relevant checkboxes:
Active: means that the user has a valid certificate associated.
New, Deleted, Inactive, Not Applicable: means that the user has no valid certificate associated.
Currently Logged in - Filter the currently logged in or not logged in users by selecting the Yes or No option.

Roles - Filter the roles in users by checking the roles checkbox.
= Filtering on users with this role assigned
!= Filtering on users with this role not assigned

section.p: Examples of Unix regular expression are:

ul.li: Dot . matches any single character. For example: "user1.2" matches "user1a2","user112a" etc.
Bracket expression [ ] matches a single character that is contained within the brackets. For example, "Kat[a-k]" matches "Kate" or "Katherine" but does not match "Katty".
Star * matches the preceding element zero or more times. For example, user10*4 matches "user14", "user104", "user140", "user141", "user142" etc.
Curly brackets {m,n} matches the preceding element at least m and not more than n times. For example, ll{1,3} matches "Allexander", "Emilly", and "Lili".

section.p: After selecting filters, user needs to click Apply.
To clear the filter, click the 'X' symbol in the search box or click Clear all Filters.
